senses.sense_definition: A traditional Japanese dagger or short sword, often worn by samurai as a secondary weapon.

examples.text: The museum displayed a beautifully preserved <w>tanto</w> from the Edo period.
A samurai would typically carry a <w>tanto</w> alongside his longer katana.

senses.sense_definition: A specific style of knife blade characterized by a straight edge and an angular, chisel-like point designed for piercing.

examples.text: He chose a tactical knife with a <w>tanto</w> blade for its durability and piercing capability.
The <w>tanto</w> point is popular in modern utility knives because the tip is very strong.

senses.sense_definition: Used in musical directions to indicate that a tempo or expression should not be performed too much or strictly.

examples.text: The composer marked the passage as allegro non <w>tanto</w> to ensure it was not played too fast.
Perform the crescendo ma non <w>tanto</w>, keeping the volume under control.
